name: Leeds Marriott Hotel

reviews.title: Rooms need refurbishing badly
reviews.text: I am getting fed up writing about my poor experiences at Marriott properties...so suffice to stay I am now going to stop staying at any Marriott branded hotel. The company has forgotten that the main reason people use hotels is to sleep. Providing beds that are so old that the mattress literally folds in the middle so that you roll into your partner and feel like you are sleeping uphill does not do that. My wife literally resorted to sleeping on the floor. The rooms overall are of 1980's livery and desperately need upgrading to justify this hotels supposedly premium branding...

reviews.title: Great stay
reviews.text: Stayed here on a one night visit to leeds. On check in, we were offered an upgrade for £40 to get a better room, access to the members lounge (free drink and nibbles from 5.30-8.30pm), and breakfast the next morning! This was definitely worth the money. The room was lovely and cosy. Visited the spa in the morning and the pool was spotless, as was the jacuzzi, steam room and sauna. Overall a lovely stay and very reasonably priced. Would definitely recommend and will probably return if we ever go back to leeds! :-)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night as we were attending a charity function at the Hotel. The hotel is nice and is situated in the centre of Leeds close to shops and nightlife.
reviews.title: One night Stop over for charity event

reviews.text: Our room was overlooking the street however the glazing meant you hear nothing it was clean and tidy and with everything you expect.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.text: Breakfast was good and good selection of food was very busy but there was no waiting for food as pointed out in previous posts.
reviews.title: 3 night stay

reviews.text: I have stayed here several times over the past 15 years (long story), and each time I dislike it but this time I hated it. Only two staff for check in and a long queue. No upgrade as others had paid for executive rooms (I am a Platinum Marriott member), no apology, no concern really. Room minuscule, bed like a trampoline and dipped in the middle. Very poor sleep owing to street noise all night, although that is hardly Marriott's fault. Then - a 20 minute queue for breakfast and few tables cleared. We left and ate elsewhere. The hotel knew they were fully booked, so why no more staff? Fortunately, the voice in lthe lift knew what was happening, I'm not convinced about the staff.
reviews.title: Unpleasant
Comfortable friendly hotel
reviews.text: Aside from some issues regarding the business function I was organising this is a really nice, comfortable and central hotel. It's worth upgrading to an executive room which gives you free access to wine, beer and snacks. Also a quieter breakfast experience! Room service was also tasty and quick. Would have liked a full size bath though...

In room 454 the bed is old that you feel the bed springs . Restaurant nice menu and the bar looks great. But if you are here to sleep look for a hotel with comfortable beds. I sure hope Marriott is not selleing these beds in their online shop. Not worth the money
reviews.title: Beds need to be renewed

reviews.text: Booked this hotel online for 1 night, only had the executive rooms available £170 thought its a bit steep but since its an executive room it must be something special, upon arriving there was nothing special about the executive room at all, it is EXACTLY like a premier in the only difference is they have a mini bar and the colour scheme is purple, the shower was basically a disabled persons wet room as it had a seat in the shower NO BATH? all in all this was not worth £170 but thanks for taking advantage, if the management do read this then go to a premier inn before you put a standard "we are sorry" reply and you will know exactly why I'm writing this review.
reviews.title: Nice but not worth the money
As good as I remember
reviews.text: This was my third stay at the Leeds Marriott and I would pick it every time. Staff all very friendly and helpful, rooms immaculately clean and spacious, great shower, comfiest beds ever, great location, excellent breakfast...need I go on? Since I was last there three years ago the breakfast room has been changed and is now self service (better) an the hotel bar has been changed, also for the better. My one gripe was having to pay £1 for BBQ sauce on the design your own burger in the bar...but everything else fab.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good points... Perfect location for shopping, pubs, clubs, couldn't be better! Everywhere clean and tidy, lovely breakfast with a good range of food. 99% of the staff fantastic, just one with a sour face.
reviews.title: Fantastic location for shops and nightlife

reviews.text: Bad points...."roll together" mattress not the usual Marriott standard. Very noisy in the night if you want the window open, certainly not the hotels fault but if you like fresh air and peace and quiet this place may not be for you.
reviews.title: Smart hotel smart location

reviews.text: Parking at Trinity car park close by will cost £9 for guests, but you will need the concierge to over ride the ticket with their stamp.
reviews.title: Fabulous stay

reviews.text: We will definitely be returning to this hotel to experience more of the great shops and restaurants Leeds has to offer.
reviews.title: Another Visit - Another Nice Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First time in this hotel. Reception nice, staff friendly, room very good, spacious and modern. Location just off Main Street in a courtyard so it's quiet. Breakfast good. Facilities also excellent.
reviews.title: Beautiful City Hotel
Great stay, would recommend this hotel
reviews.text: Arrived just after noon so took our chance and asked for early check in! Receptionist couldn't have been more helpful, we were checked in and upgraded. Third floor room was very comfortable with queen size bed. We didn't have breakfast so can't comment, but our overall impression was great, would love to stay here again.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: We'd booked the Marriott for a girls weekend & travelled as a party of six - two in each room. The hotel was, was as described a short walk from Leeds train station, and as we arrived early were able to leave our cases with reception.

reviews.title: Group of 22 - great stay!
reviews.text: The hotel is well located for the shops, with a short walk across the road to the Trinity Centre.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was straight forward with a cash pay now option or the swipe of a card & the hotel receptionist was kind enough to book a taxi for the evening after we'd asked how far the evenings Resturant was.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: The rooms were spacious with twin queen beds in & nice towels (including a spare!) there was tea & coffee facilities & a mini bar though any alcoholic drinks had to be ordered via room service. Importantly for us, there was enough plug sockets & mirrors for us to both be getting ready at the same time, and the hair dryer was ok.
reviews.title: Very comfortable hotel in the centre of Leeds

description: A modern elegant 4 star hotel in the heart of the City Centre.The Leeds Marriott Hotel is a short walk to the train station, Victoria Quarter, Royal Armouries Museum & The Trinity Shopping Centre is just across the road from the Hotel.Leeds Bradford International Airport is approximately 20 minutes Taxi ride away.Our upscale hotel evokes European charm and welcomes you with friendly staff and wonderful amenities.
